description: Economic moat strength rating based on Buffett's investment criteria
research_basis: Weights derived from Warren Buffett's investment philosophy research (2025-10-26). ROE weighted highest (35%) as Buffett emphasizes it as key competitive advantage indicator (minimum 15%, prefers consistency). Gross margin second (30%) as Buffett prefers >40% margins indicating pricing power. Intangibles (20%) reflect brand/patent value. Switching costs (15%) lowest as most qualitative. Sources: Buffett shareholder letters, 'Warren Buffett and the Interpretation of Financial Statements', GuruFocus moat analysis.

roe_consistency.description: 5-year average ROE - Buffett's key profitability indicator
roe_consistency.notes: Buffett requires minimum 15% average ROE, consistency over time more important than peak values

gross_margin.description: 5-year average gross profit margin - indicates pricing power
gross_margin.notes: Buffett prefers consistently high gross margins (>40%) as indicator of durable competitive advantage

intangibles.notes: Strong brands/patents create moats, but balance sheet may not fully reflect value (e.g., Coca-Cola)

switching_costs.description: Qualitative assessment of customer switching costs
switching_costs.notes: Most qualitative component - requires sector/industry analysis
